page.title: 15Easington Village CE School
page.content: The first school was built in 1814 but by 1855 there was another school. Soon after 1870 a larger school was built and it remained so until 1966 when the present school was built. Our school's full name is Easington C E (Controlled) Junior Mixed & Infants School. There are 107 children in the school. There are five teachers. There are five teachers; Mrs Rowell, Mrs Robinson (deputy head), Mrs Jameson, Mrs Stewart, and Mr Liddle the headmaster. There are about 90 children who stay for school dinners - cost 60p a day.
